page.title: 14HISTORIC BUILDING LIVINGSTON
page.content: Houses of historical importance in our area are{Bankton House, Murieston {House, Nether Williamston}and{Skivo {Farm. Bankton House}was built in 1812 for James Bruce, a Secretary of Excise. The house is a plain Georgian two story building made of coarse rubble and has a slated roof. Today it is privately owned and has been converted into a bar and restaurant. {Murieston House}was built in 1800 for an Edinburgh banker called Henry Jamieson. The house is similiar to Bankton House and is occupied.{Nether {Williamston}Farmhouse dates back to the 1600's.{Skivo Farm}is an 18th century traditional one storey building with a loft and byres that form three sides of a yard. It is built of random rubble with a slate roof and has pantiled roofed byres.
